description: Weekly science radio program hosted by Dr. Charles Lee and Dr. Frank Ling.  Each show features interviews with scientists and technical innovators, humorous commentary on recent discoveries, plus the Grokotron 5000 and the World Famous Question of the Week!  Tune in every week and rediscover the world as you think you know it.
title: Groks Science Radio Show and Podcast

episodes.title: Smithsonian Science -— Groks Science Show 2020-11-11
episodes.description: James Smithson may be best known as the namesake of the Smithsonian Institution, but his scientific accomplishments are often overlooked.  On this episode, Steven Turner discussed his new book, The Science of James Smithson.

episodes.title: Nose Dive -— Groks Science Show 2020-11-04
episodes.description: The sense of smell is of profound importance, but few may realize it until it is gone. The diversity of chemicals producing smells is even more astounding. On this episode, Harold McGee discussed his new book, Nose Dive.

episodes.title: Alignment Problem -— Groks Science Show 2020-10-28
episodes.description: Although the advances in artificial intelligence have been striking in recent years, has as much thought been given to the ethical issues surround the design of these systems? On this episode, Brian Christian discussed his new book, The Alignment Problem.

episodes.title: Meteorites -— Groks Science Show 2020-10-21
episodes.description: The natural history of the earth and solar system can be surprisingly gleaned from the study of meteorites.  On this episode, Dr. Tim Gregory discussed his new book, Meteorite: How Stones From Outer Space Made Our World.

episodes.title: Bones -— Groks Science Show 2020-10-14
episodes.description: Bones may be some of the most remarkable biological structures in our bodies, but few may stop to realize their many functions.  On this episode, Dr. Roy A. Meals discussed his book, Bones: Inside and Out.

episodes.title: Immortality Key -— Groks Science Show 2020-10-07
episodes.description: Did the early Christian church inherit a psychedelic Eucharist from the Greeks?  What evidence exist from the historical record and archeological chemistry?  On this episode, Brian C. Muraresku discussed his new book, The Immortality Key.

episodes.title: Pediatric Advances -— Groks Science Show 2020-09-30
episodes.description: Through advances in modern medicine and public health, infant mortality has been largely relegated to the past.  On this episode, Dr. Perri Klass discussed how science and medicine gave children a future.

episodes.title: AI Countdown -— Groks Science Show 2020-09-23
episodes.description: Artificial intelligence has expanded greatly, such that it has reshaped the modern world.  What is the future of AI?  On this episode, Michael Kanaan discussed his book, T-Minus AI.

episodes.title: Modern Madness -— Groks Science Show 2020-09-16
episodes.description: Mental health issues often hides in the darkness, but what can we be done to increase understanding and awareness of mental health?  On this episode, Terri Cheney discussed her book, Modern Madness: An Owner's Manual.

episodes.title: Psychological Reckoning -— Groks Science Show 2020-09-09
episodes.description: The internal narratives that form a basis for personality psychology may be a factor that distinguishes the 45th President of the United States.  On this episode, Prof. Dan McAdams discusses his new book, The Strange Case of Donald J. Trump: A Psychological Reckoning.

episodes.title: Rebel Cell -— Groks Science Show 2020-09-02
episodes.description: Cancer is perhaps the oldest and most formidable disease that has plagued human history.  How are new theoretical advances improving our understanding of how to treat cancer?  On this episode, Kat Arney discussed her new book, Rebel Cell.

episodes.title: Synchronicity -— Groks Science Show 2020-08-26
episodes.description: Of the many phenomena in quantum mechanics, perhaps none is as strange as quantum entanglement.  What does this imply for the physical laws of the natural world as we know it?  On this episode, Dr. Paul Halpern discussed his new book, Synchronicity.

episodes.title: Self Reg -— Groks Science Show 2020-08-19
episodes.description: How can a society be justly organized?  Does it depend on the ability of the citizenry to self regulate?  On this episode, Dr. Stuart Shanker discussed his new book, Reframed: Self Reg for a Just Society.

episodes.title: Bunker -— Groks Science Show 2020-08-12
episodes.description: The fragility and weak points in societal structures may cause worry and consternation in most.  But, some individuals respond instead by building.  On this episode, Bradley Garrett discussed his new book, Bunker: Building for the End Times.

episodes.title: Universe Two -— Groks Science Show 2020-08-05
episodes.description: The Manhattan Project represents one of the most scientifically innovative, yet ethically challenged endeavors of our time.  On this episode, Stephen P. Kiernan discusses the human dimensions of this project in his new book, Universe of Two.

episodes.title: Mindful Temperance -— Groks Science Show 2020-07-29
episodes.description: Alcohol use can be problematic if individuals are unable to control their intake.  This can be made more difficult living in a culture that promotes drinking.  On this episode, Lisa Boucher discussed her book, Raising the Bottom.

episodes.title: Discord Power -— Groks Science Show 2020-07-22
episodes.description: Harmony in relationships is often sought as the ideal state of affairs, but can discord be even more powerful in building healthy relationships?  On this episode, Dr. Claudia M. Gold discussed her new book, The Power of Discord.

episodes.title: Cyberbullying -— Groks Science Show 2020-07-15
episodes.description: With the mandated quarantines affecting children and their peers, bullying and cyberbullying have taken on new forms.  On this episode, Dr. Elizabeth Englander discussed her book, 25 Myths About Bullying and Cyberbullying.

episodes.title: Writing Wild -— Groks Science Show 2020-07-08
episodes.description: Our appreciation for the natural world is influenced by great nature writing.  However, the contribution of women to this genre has often been unappreciated.  On this episode, Kathryn Aalto discussed these writers in her new book, Writing Wild.

episodes.title: Oncology Excellence -— Groks Science Show 2020-07-01
episodes.description: Although medical science has advanced cancer treatment, it has not been well implemented throughout the world, especially in developing countries.  On this episode, Dr. B.S. Ajaikumar discussed his new book, Excellence Has No Borders.

episodes.title: Bezonomics -— Groks Science Show 2020-06-24
episodes.description: The incredible ubiquity of Amazon in our current economy has influenced not just online retailing, but other areas as well.  What is the data driven approach employed by this company?  On this episode, Brian Dumaine discussed his new book, Bezonomics.

episodes.title: Opportunity Mindset -— Groks Science Show 2020-06-17
episodes.description: The world is full of chaotic and unexpected events.  So, what is the best method for dealing with a crisis?  On this episode, Dr. Jim Taylor discussed his new book, How to Survive and Thrive When Bad Things Happen.

episodes.title: Growing Young -— Groks Science Show 2020-06-10
episodes.description: Longevity is often discussed in terms of good diet and exercise, but the role of kindness, happiness, and sociability are often overlooked.  On this episode, Marta Zaruska discussed her new book, Growing Young.

episodes.title: Assassins Night -— Groks Science Show 2020-06-03
episodes.description: The world would be a very different place had FDR, Churchill, and Stalin not been the leaders during World War II.  This almost would have happened had a Nazi assassination plot succeeded.  On this episode, Howard Blum discussed his new book, Night of the Assassins.

episodes.title: Body Dragging -— Groks Science Show 2020-05-27
episodes.description: Being prepared is a motto that is often easier said than done.  How do we prepare for the extraordinary situations that we may encounter in our lives?  On this episode, Judith Matloff discussed her book, How to Drag a Body.

episodes.title: Mapping Humanity -— Groks Science Show 2020-05-20
episodes.description: Modern genetics is changing many aspects from society from criminal justice to medicine.  On this episode, Joshua Z. Rappoport discussed his new book, Mapping Humanity.

episodes.title: Bird Way -— Groks Science Show 2020-05-13
episodes.description: The remarkable behavior of birds is sometimes confounding when viewed from an anthropomorphic lens.  What is the bird way?  On this episode, Jennifer Ackerman discussed her new book, The Bird Way.

episodes.title: The First -— Groks Science Show 2020-05-06
episodes.description: Free speech is often touted as a guiding principle of American civic life, but is this truly the case?  What is guaranteed under the first amendment to the constitution?  On this episode, Prof. Stanley Fish discussed his book, The First.

episodes.title: Patient Rights -— Groks Science Show 2020-04-29
episodes.description: Of the many issues with the health care system in the United States, the lack of transparency for costs and patient's health data may be among the most pressing issues.  On this episode, Cynthia A. Fisher discussed advocating for the rights of patients.

episodes.title: Impostures -— Groks Science Show 2020-04-22
episodes.description: Can a literary work be untranslatable, especially if the work is meant to highlight the uniqueness of a language itself?  On this episode, Michael Cooperson discussed his new translation of the works of the Silk Merchant, Impostures: Fifty Rogues Tales Translated Fifty Ways.

episodes.title: Revitalized Space -— Groks Science Show 2020-04-15
episodes.description: Public urban spaces are central to civic life, but the revitalization and upkeep of these spaces is critical to their success.  On this episode, Andrew Manshel discussed his book, Learning from Bryant Park.

episodes.title: Ingredients -— Groks Science Show 2020-04-08
episodes.description: The goods and foods that are produced and manufactured around us contain both natural and unnatural chemicals.  How much is known about the chemistry of everyday goods?  On this episode, George Zaidan discussed the chemistry of what we put on us and in us.

episodes.title: Plate Peace -— Groks Science Show 2020-04-01
episodes.description: Eating disorders are characterized by more than just the physiological processes in the body, but also importantly the mental health process involved.  On this episode, Robyn Cruze discussed her book, Making Peace with Your Plate.

episodes.title: Underwater Blast -— Groks Science Show 2020-03-25
episodes.description: The H.L. Hunley was a civil war submarine whose recovery raised more questions than answers.  On this episode, Rachel Lance discussed her investigation of this subject in her new book, In the Waves.

episodes.title: Space Fight -— Groks Science Show 2020-03-18
episodes.description: The story of Jackie Cochran and Jerrie Cobb is a fascinating tale of two accomplished pilots fighting for the future of women in space.  On this episode, Amy Shira Teitel discussed her book, Fighting for Space.

episodes.title: Space Age Women -— Groks Science Show 2020-03-11
episodes.description: The history of women in the space age is captured in a fascinating exhibit featuring collections of images from this past.  On this episode, Dr. Julie Wosk discussed her exhibit, Imaging Women in the Space Age.

episodes.title: Electric Brain -— Groks Science Show 2020-03-04
episodes.description: Brainwaves may seem like the subject of science fiction, but the study of these brainwaves is at the forefront of modern neuroscience.  On this episode, R. Douglas Fields discussed his book, Electric Brain.

episodes.title: Balanced Body -— Groks Science Show 2020-02-26
episodes.description: Although food is essential for survival, eating the wrong types of food may be deleterious to our health.  What is the role of hormones in our food supply and our health?  On this episode, Dr. Neal Barnard discussed his book, Your Body in Balance.

episodes.title: Scientist Spy -— Groks Science Show 2020-02-19
episodes.description: International competition for technological resources often leads to intellectual espionage, even over a resource as seemingly mundane as corn.  On this episode, Mara Hvistendahl discussed her book, The Scientist and the Spy.

episodes.title: Its Elementary -— Groks Science Show 2020-02-12
episodes.description: There is a question of a periodic table analogue for elementary particles and the nature of dark energy and dark matter. On this episode, Thomas Buckholtz joins us to discuss these classic problems and unified approaches for explaining them.

episodes.title: Sex Matters -— Groks Science Show 2020-02-05
episodes.description: Our emotional health is intimately related to the proper operations of evolutionarily ancient parts of our brain.  How can our sex lives be a window into these critical aspects of our brains?  On this episode, Dr. Nan Wise discussed her book, Why Good Sex Matters.

episodes.title: Friendship -— Groks Science Show 2020-01-29
episodes.description: Friendship is an important part of maintaining a healthy mental life, but can it also improve our biological health?  On this episode, Lydia Denworth discussed the new science of friendship.

episodes.title: Transcendence -— Groks Science Show 2020-01-22
episodes.description: The success of humans as a species is often attributed to the profound increase in brain size.  However, does culture have a more important role?  On this episode, Gaia Vince discussed her new book, Transcendence.

episodes.title: Exercise Medicine -— Groks Science Show 2020-01-15
episodes.description: Aging may seem like an inevitable deterioration of our bodies, but is there a routine way to prevent it?  Can exercise help?  On this episode, Judy Foreman discussed her book, Exercise is Medicine.

episodes.title: Polar Expedition -— Groks Science Show 2020-01-08
episodes.description: The polar region continues to be a mysterious and unexplored region of the earth.  One of the first to explore the area was an expedition led by Adolphus W. Greely.  On this episode, Buddy Levy discussed the Greely Polar Expedition.

episodes.title: Astrophysicist Letters -— Groks Science Show 2019-12–18
episodes.description: How can a scientific perspective on the world inform us about non-scientific issues?  On this episode, Neil deGrasse Tyson discussed his new book, Letters from an Astrophysicist.

episodes.title: Medical Parenting -— Groks Science Show 2019-12–11
episodes.description: Navigating the medical system can be daunting, but even more so for parents caring for the well-being of their children.  On this episode, Dr. Jacqueline Jones discussed the issues of medical parenting.

episodes.title: Planetology -— Groks Science Show 2019-12–04
episodes.description: The development of the planets and the solar system has continued to intrigue scientists.  Recent advances in planetary science have broadened our perspective on the issue.  On this episode, Dr. Erik Asphaug discussed his book, When the Earth had Two Moons.

episodes.title: Charts -— Groks Science Show 2019-11–27
episodes.description: Charts and graphical displays of information are essential to the modern age, but they are only as useful if one is prepared to us them.  On this episode, Prof. Alberto Cairo discussed his book, How Charts Lie.

episodes.title: Imagined Life -— Groks Science Show 2019-11–20
episodes.description: What is the possibility of life elsewhere in the universe?  How much closer are we to determining this issue?  On this episode, Professor Michael Summers discussed the possibility of extraterrestrial life in his book, Imagined Life.

episodes.title: Hearing -— Groks Science Show 2019-11–13
episodes.description: Hearing is one of the basic senses that is often ignored until something goes wrong.  What can we do to protect our hearing and what are the current treatments for hearing problems?  On this episode, David Owen discussed his book, Volume Control.

episodes.title: Galileo Error -— Groks Science Show 2019-11–06
episodes.description: The scientific study of consciousness continues to be plagued by a gap in understanding that may be traced to the foundations of modern science.  On this episode, Philip Goff discussed the foundations for a new science of consciousness.

episodes.title: Rabbit Effect -— Groks Science Show 2019-10–30
episodes.description: Although modern medicine has improved health outcomes in the past century, it continues to overlook hidden factors for human health, such as kindness.  On this episode, Dr. Kelli Harding discussed the Rabbit Effect.

episodes.title: Nature Lessons -— Groks Science Show 2019-10–23
episodes.description: The modern world has often forced us to become divorced from our connections with nature.  On this episode, Gary Ferguson discussed eight master lessons of nature.

episodes.title: Human Compatible -— Groks Science Show 2019-10–16
episodes.description: Artificial intelligence is rapidly outpacing the human ability to control it.  How can we design human compatible AI systems?  On this episode, Stuart Russell discussed the design of human compatible AI.

episodes.title: Big Book -— Groks Science Show 2019-10–09
episodes.description: Among all of the self recovery programs, alcoholics anonymous may be the most influential and the foundation for all those that followed.  On this episode, William Schaberg discussed Writing the Big Book: The Creation of A.A.

episodes.title: Conscious Feeling -— Groks Science Show 2019-10–02
episodes.description: How does the brain give rise to subject feelings and is this the basis for consciousness?  On this episode, Dr. Christof Koch discussed his research on consciousness.

episodes.title: Dog Love -— Groks Science Show 2019-09–25
episodes.description: Dogs may be unique in the capacity to form emotional bonds.  What are the biological underpinnings of this behavior?  On this episode, Dr. Clive Wynne discussed his book, Dog is Love.

episodes.title: Dice God -— Groks Science Show 2019-09–18
episodes.description: The universe is filled with uncertainty, from the fundamental to the uncalculable.  But, how can we deal with uncertainty in our predictions of the future.  On this episode, Prof. Ian Stewart discussed Do Dice Play God.

episodes.title: Lost Mind -— Groks Science Show 2019-09–11
episodes.description: How do the operations of the brain result in the mind?  And, how has the study of the two been influenced by early medical cases?  On this episode, Drs. Allan H. Ropper and Brian Burrell discussed how the brain lost its mind.

episodes.title: xkcd -— Groks Science Show 2019-09–04
episodes.description: What is the best way to solve an everyday problem?  On this episode, Randall Munroe, creator of xkcd, discussed his new book, How To: Absurd Scientific Advice for Common Real-World Problems.

episodes.title: Opium -— Groks Science Show 2019-08–28
episodes.description: The opioid epidemic continues to affect countless lives, but how did it get to this point?  What is the history of opium and its derivative opioids?  On this episode, Dr. John Halpern discussed how an ancient flower shaped and poisoned our world.

episodes.title: Mirror Mirror -— Groks Science Show 2019-08–21
episodes.description: Can your bathroom mirror show more than your reflection? On this episode, Thomas Serval discusses an operating system that works behind your mirror to enhance our digital lifestyle.

episodes.title: Mirror Mirror -— Groks Science Show 2019-08–21
episodes.description: Can your bathroom mirror show more than your reflection? On this episode, Thomas Serval discusses an operating system that works behind your mirror to enhance our digital lifestyle.

episodes.title: Strange Harvests -— Groks Science Show 2019-08–14
episodes.description: The natural world is filled with resources that are harvested without thought for the long term consequences.  Can we live sustainably with the environment?  On this episode, Edward Posnett discussed the strange harvests.

episodes.title: Stress Switch -— Groks Science Show 2019-08–07
episodes.description: Stress can be overwhelming and sometimes even debilitating, but how can we deal with mild or chronic stress?  On this episode, Dr. Amy Serin discussed the stress switch.

episodes.title: Robotic Cars -— Groks Science Show 2019-07–31
episodes.description: Advances in automated car technology are poised to revolutionize transportation.  But, when will see the first generation of robotic cars?  On this episode, Jason Torchinsky discussed Robot, Take the Wheel.

episodes.title: Lost Civilization -— Groks Science Show 2019-07–24
episodes.description: The American continents are often referred to as the New World by anthropologists. But could civilization have started far earlier than most experts think? On this episode, Graham Hancock discusses his hypothesis of a lost civilization.

episodes.title: Voice Technology -— Groks Science Show 2019-07–17
episodes.description: One of the annoyances of modern life is background noise in our phone conversations. On this program, Davit Baghdasaryan discussed his AI powered app KRISP, which gives us clean voice communication.

episodes.title: Apollo Legacy -— Groks Science Show 2019-07–10
episodes.description: The 50th anniversary of the first landings on the moon mark a notable landmark in the technological achievements of humanity.  But, what is the legacy of the Apollo missions?  On this episode, Dr. Roger Launius discussed the legacy of the moon landings.

episodes.title: Language Death -— Groks Science Show 2019-07–03
episodes.description: What happens when a language dies?  What happens to the culture and history of the speakers of that language?  On this episode, Prof. Don Kulick discussed his book, A Death in The Rainforest.

episodes.title: Sky Fire -— Groks Science Show 2019-06–26
episodes.description: Meteoric impacts are extremely frequent events on the earth, so much so that the next one might completely destroy the planet.  On this episode, Gordon L. Dillow discussed these events in his book, Fire in the Sky.

episodes.title: Generic Drugs -— Groks Science Show 2019-06–19
episodes.description: Generic drugs are a ubiquitous part of the pharmaceutical market, but do they deliver the same effects?  On this episode, Ms. Katherine Eban discussed problems with generic drug manufacturing.

episodes.title: Creative Evolution -— Groks Science Show 2019-06–12
episodes.description: Creativity and evolution may seem to be two completely different ideas, but what can the theory of evolution teach us about the creative process?  On this episode, Dr. Andreas Wagner discussed his book, Life Finds a Way.

episodes.title: Number Universe -— Groks Science Show 2019-06–05
episodes.description: Can advances in theoretical math explain fundamental problems in physics and can experimental physics ever test some of these purely mathematical theories?  On this episode, Graham Farmelo discussed his book, The Universe Speaks in Numbers.

episodes.title: Animal Symphony -— Groks Science Show 2019-05–29
episodes.description: The bond shared with animals defines much of what makes us human, but how can empathy and shared destinies with animals affect our physical, mental, and societal health?  On this episode, Dr. Ayshar Akhtar discussed our symphony with animals?

episodes.title: Walking Life -— Groks Science Show 2019-05–22
episodes.description: Walking may be one of the unique aspects of humanity is our ability for bipedal walking.  But, how has our modern lifestyle affected this uniquely human ability?  On this episode. Antonia Malchik discussed a Walking Life.

episodes.title: Scientific Attitude -— Groks Science Show 2019-05–15
episodes.description: Scientific findings are under increasing attack from pseudoscientific views.  Why does this persist and what can be done to address this issue?  On this episode, Lee C. McIntyre discussed the scientific attitude.

episodes.title: Evolutionary View -— Groks Science Show 2019-05–08
episodes.description: The theory of evolution can be applied to many aspects of human life, not just the genetic.  On this episode, David Sloan Wilson discussed this view of life.

episodes.title: Lost World -— Groks Science Show 2019-05–01
episodes.description: The history of the settlement of North America may be more complicated than the classic story of the land bridge.  On this episode, Craig Childs discussed the Atlas of a Lost World.

episodes.title: Eat Disease -— Groks Science Show 2019-04–24
episodes.description: You are what you eat, so the old saying goes.  But, can you eat to beat disease?  On this episode, Dr. William W. Li discussed eating to beat disease.

episodes.title: Decentralized Currency -— Groks Science Show 2019-04–17
episodes.description: In spite of their potential, Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies have not met the promise of a global money standard. On this episode, Bram Cohen discusses sustainable blockchain for next generation digital currency.

episodes.title: Strange Order -— Groks Science Show 2019-04–10
episodes.description: The organization of human culture and society is often touted as the pinnacle of the rational human mind.  But, are more basic affective processes actually at play?  On this episode, Prof. Antonio Damasio discussed the strange order of things.

episodes.title: Authoritative Science -— Groks Science Show 2019-04–03
episodes.description: How has the role of science in society been shaped?  Who were the key thinkers and how has scientific authority evolved?  On this episode, Dr. Robert Crease discussed the workshop and the world.

episodes.title: Fresh Air -— Groks Science Show 2019-03–27
episodes.description: Air pollution not only drives climate change but also respiratory and other health problems. On this episode, Jos Lelieveld discussed how lives could be saved today and in the future by eliminating the emissions associated with burning fossil fuels.

episodes.title: Cool Space -— Groks Science Show 2019-03–20
episodes.description: Outer space is certainly cool, but just how cool is it?  On this episode, Kate Howells discussed her new book, Space is Cool as F-ck.

episodes.title: Perfect Predator -— Groks Science Show 2019-03–13
episodes.description: How do you fight an antibiotic-resistant bacteria?  What would you do if one of your loved ones was fighting off such a bacteria?  On this episode, Dr. Stephanie Strathdee discussed her story in the Perfect Predator.

episodes.title: Muscle Science -— Groks Science Show 2019-03–06
episodes.description: What are the scientific principles behind building a bigger, leaner, and stronger body?  On this episode, Michael Matthews discussed the scientific principles behind building muscle.

episodes.title: Dopamine -— Groks Science Show 2019-02–27
episodes.description: Can one molecule in the brain influence all of our daily desires and drives?  On this episode, Dr. Daniel Lieberman discussed the molecule of more.

episodes.title: Life Admin -— Groks Science Show 2019-02–20
episodes.description: Although the daily chores of life may seem to be a burden, the ability to deal with these tasks is of growing importance.  On this episode, Elizabeth Emens discussed tips and tricks for life admin.

episodes.title: Lookout America -— Groks Science Show 2019-02–13
episodes.description: The most important Hollywood studio of the cold war is one that you probably do not even know about.  On this episode, Prof. Ned OGorman discussed the Lookout Mountain Studios.

episodes.title: Globalism Nativism -— Groks Science Show 2019-02–06
episodes.description: The current trends around the world that drive the tension between globalism and nativism have buoyed many populist governmental changes.  On this episode, Dr. Alexandre Muns Rubiol discussed how to bridge the digital divide.

episodes.title: Mojito Diet -— Groks Science Show 2019-01–30
episodes.description: A healthy lifestyle is always beneficial, but how can a mojito help?  On this episode, Dr. Juan Rivera discussed the mojito diet.

episodes.title: Enchanted Hour -— Groks Science Show 2019-01–23
episodes.description: Reading aloud has enormous benefits for children and adults, but why has this ancient activity fallen by the wayside?  On this episode. Meghan Cox Gurdon discussed the power of reading aloud.

episodes.title: Hormone Disruption -— Groks Science Show 2019-01–16
episodes.description: Hormone disrupting chemicals are found in our everyday environment, but what can we do to fight back?  On this episode, Dr. Leonardo Trassande discussed the problem of hormone disrupting chemicals.

episodes.title: Einstein Breakfast -— Groks Science Show 2019-01–09
episodes.description: Quantum mechanics may seem to be an esoteric topic that has little impact on our daily lives.  Surprisingly, one can find the influence of quantum mechanics in our daily breakfast.  On this episode, Chad Orzel discussed Breakfast with Einstein.

episodes.title: Otterficial Intelligence -— Groks Science Show 2019-01–02
episodes.description: What if computers could be as smart as otters? What would they do? On this program, Sam Liang joins us to talk about his artificial intelligence startup.

episodes.title: Setpoint Diet -— Groks Science Show 2018-12–26
episodes.description: The setpoint theory suggests that our bodies have a natural range of weight that is determined.  This setpoint can be changed to improve health and longevity.  On this episode, Jonathan Bailor discussed the setpoint diet.

episodes.title: Dark Light -— Groks Science Show 2018-12–19
episodes.description: Chronic illness can be a challenge for those coping with their condition.  How can one transcend a chronic illness?  On this episode, Lisa Sniderman discussed a Light in the Darkness.

episodes.title: Economic Puzzles -— Groks Science Show 2018-12–12
episodes.description: Economics may be called the dismal science, but an economic perspective could help solve many puzzles in everyday life.  On this episode, Steven Landsburg discussed how to outsmart an economist.

episodes.title: Medical Mysteries -— Groks Science Show 2018-12–05
episodes.description: What can exploding teeth tell us about the progress of medical science?  On this episode, Thomas Morris will discuss the mystery of the exploding teeth.

episodes.title: Home Fauna -— Groks Science Show 2018-11–28
episodes.description: Although a spotless home may seem like a land where no creature may venture, one might be surprised to find several species residing there.  On this episode, Rob Dunn discussed the animals that never leave us home alone.

episodes.title: Space History -— Groks Science Show 2018-11–21
episodes.description: The history of space exploration is vast and encompasses centuries of human activity.  On this episode, Roger D. Launius discussed the Smithsonian history of space exploration.

episodes.title: Animal Myths -— Groks Science Show 2018-11–14
episodes.description: The animal kingdom is a diverse and exciting place, but how much of what we know about it is true?  On this episode, Nick Caruso discussed the truths and myths about the animal kingdom.

episodes.title: Einstein Shadow -— Groks Science Show 2018-11–07
episodes.description: Black holes capture everything that passes its event horizon, even light.  So, how can a black hole be seen?  On this episode, Seth Fletcher discussed the event horizon telescope.

episodes.title: Zombification -— Groks Science Show 2018-10–31
episodes.description: Zombies may seem confined to the stories of horror fiction, but the animal kingdom is replete with examples of real zombification.  On this episode, Matt Simon discussed the plight of the living dead.

episodes.title: Toba Catastrophe -— Groks Science Show 2018-10–24
episodes.description: Humans nearly vanished due to a major explosion from the Toba Volcano.  On this episode, Dr. Donald Prothero discusses when humans nearly vanished.

episodes.title: The Future Forward -— Groks Science Show 2018-10–17
episodes.description: What does it take to make an impact in the tech publishing world? What leadership qualities and values do we need to build a successful and trustworthy organization? On this episode, Glenn Rifkin talks about the founder of IDG publishing and the lessons to thrive in the global computer publishing industry.

episodes.title: In My Hands -— Groks Science Show 2018-10–10
