episodes.title: Intimate Bond -- Groks Science Show 2016-01-20
episodes.description: The interaction between humans and animals has varied dramatically throughout human history. On this episode, Brian Fagan discussed how animals have shaped our history and how our conception of them has changed over time.

episodes.title: Paris Accord -- Groks Science Show 2016-01-13
episodes.description: The international negotiations for addressing climate change has been fraught with rancor but the COP21 meeting in Paris last month marks a turning point. On this program, David Victor discusses the Paris Agreement.

episodes.title: Ancient Human Civilizations -- Groks Science Show 2016-01-06
episodes.description: The history of ancient human civilization is mysterious almost by definition. On this episode, Graham Hancock presents an alternative story of the past.

episodes.title: Food Security -- Groks Science Show 2015-12-30
episodes.description: Are we prepared to cope with food shortages? On this episode, Margaret Nelson discusses how social factors plays a role determining the survivability of societies.

episodes.title: Magical Science -- Groks Science Show 2015-12-23
episodes.description: What does mythology tell us about the scientific environment of those who created them?  On this episode, Matt Kaplan discussed the science of the magical.

episodes.title: Gene Editing -- Groks Science Show 2015-12-16
episodes.description: Scientists can now make precise changes to the DNA of humans and animals thanks to recent advances in gene editing technology. On this episode, Dr. Hank Greely discussed the medical promises and perils of this technology.

episodes.title: Forest Carbon Dynamics -- Groks Science Show 2015-12-09
episodes.description: What are the effects of climate change on forests? On this episode, William Anderegg discusses forest carbon dynamics.

episodes.title: Prescribing Placebos -- Groks Science Show 2015-12-02
episodes.description: Throughout history, physicians have made use of the placebo effect.  On this episode, Professor John Kelley discussed the mechanisms of the placebo effect and its role in medicine.

episodes.title: Traumatic Brain Injury -- Groks Science Show 2015-11-25
episodes.description: Traumatic brain injury can result in the emergence of severe psychiatric symptoms.  On this episode, Dr. Sandeep Vaishnavi discussed the diagnosis and treatment of psychiatic problems associated with traumatic brain injury.

episodes.title: Sentimental Sense -- Groks Science Show 2015-11-18
episodes.description: The connection between scent and memory is powerful and can be startling.  On this episode, Dr. Virginia Barry, Chicago psychoanalyst and discussed the neuroscience behind memory and scent.

episodes.title: Aerosols Stratospheric -- Groks Science Show 2015-11-11
episodes.description: How do aerosols, or tiny particles, affect the climate? On this program, John Moore discusses the science of dust in the sky.

episodes.title: Debating Time -- Groks Science Show 2015-11-04
episodes.description: n 1922, two famous men publically debated the nature of time. On this episode, Jimena Canales discussed the debate of Albert Einstin and Henri Bergson.

episodes.title: Brain History -- Groks Science Show 2015-10-28
episodes.description: The history of neuroscience is still in a relative infancy compared with other sciences. On this episode, Tom Jackson discussed an illustrated history of the brain.

episodes.title: Quotable Feynman -- Groks Science Show 2015-10-21
episodes.description: Richard Feynman is known as one of the most imaginative and beloved physicists in history. On this episode, Michelle Feynman discusses quotes from her father and memories she has of him.

episodes.title: Improbability Principle -- Groks Science Show 2015-10-07
episodes.description: When is a coincidence not a coincidence?  On this episode, Dr. David Hand discusses his book, The Improbability Principle, and why miracles and coincidences happen much more often than we would expect.

episodes.title: Narcissism -- Groks Science Show 2015-09-30
episodes.description: Narcissism may have become more prevalent and even celebrated in society.  On this episode, Dr. Joseph Burgo discussed the narcissist you know.

episodes.title: Mixed Fires -- Groks Science Show 2015-09-23
episodes.description: Mixed severity fires help to rejuvenate the forests, but how will current policy shifts affect the health of the forests.  On this episode, Dominick DellaSalla discussed the importance of mixed severity fires.

episodes.title: SuperBetter -- Groks Science Show 2015-09-16
episodes.description: Games are great at activating our motivation and putting us in a problem solving mindset. On this episode, Jane McGonigal discussed SuperBetter, a method of using a gameful mindset to approach challenges in life.

episodes.title: Mercury Mystery -- Groks Science Show 2015-09-09
episodes.description: Scientists have long known and taught that mercury is a neurotoxin in humans and animals. On this program, Jennifer Cossaboon talks about a surprising source of mercury in the seas.

episodes.title: Autisms Mysteries -- Groks Science Show 2015-09-02
episodes.description: Despite increasing awareness about autism, it remains one of the most mysterious topics of this generation. On this episode, Steve Silberman addresses some of the mysteries of autism.

episodes.title: Driverless -- Groks Science Show 2015-08-26
episodes.description: Several companies are getting very close to launching their first lines of unmanned vehicles. On this episode, Corey Clothier discussed the state of autonomous vehicles.

episodes.title: Controlling Aging -- Groks Science Show 2015-08-19
episodes.description: How much of the aging process is inevitable and how much can we control?  On this episode, Dr. Michael Roizen discussed controlling the aging process.

episodes.title: Commencing Transmission -- Groks Science Show 2015-08-12
episodes.description: The brain works by sending signals between cells through the rapid-fire release of neurotransmitters. On this episode, Alex Brunger discusses how specific proteins trigger communication between brain cells.

episodes.title: Supporting Innovation -- Groks Science Show 2015-08-05
episodes.description: Dr. Kathie Olsen discussed the current budgetary crunch in scientific funding and how it affects researchers in the United States.

episodes.title: Animal Cannabis -- Groks Science Show 2015-07-29
episodes.description: Watching a pet suffer through an illness can be heartbreaking, but can cannabis be a therapeutic to alleviate pain in animals?  On this episode, Darlene Arden discussed medical cannabis for animals.

episodes.title: Moores Law -- Groks Science Show 2015-07-22
episodes.description: Gordon Moore has perhaps done more to revolutionize our modern world than any other scientist, but few may know about his achievements.  On this episode, Arnold Thackray discussed the life and times of Gordon Moore.

episodes.title: A Beautiful Question-- Groks Science Show 2015-07-15
episodes.description: What do movie stars, ocean sunsets, and the fundamental laws of physics all have in common? On this episode, Frank Wilczek discussed how the universe embodies beautiful ideas and the ways this realization has affected his work.

episodes.title: Chemistry of Aging -- Groks Science Show 2015-07-08
episodes.description: How do we measure aging and does everyone age at the same rate? On this program, Dan Bleksy answers these questions and what our appearances tell us about the age of our organs.

episodes.title: Zen and Cytology -- Groks Science Show 2015-07-01
episodes.description: Drs. Jeffrey Mueller and Allison Cavallo discuss their mission trips to Nigeria and other African countries where they provided care in underserved populations.

episodes.title: Unprocessed -- Groks Science Show 2015-06-24
episodes.description: Our food supply is so integral to our lives that few may notice the degree of processing involved.  On this episode, Megan Kimble discussed unprocessed foods.

episodes.title: Girl Power -- Groks Science Show 2015-06-17
episodes.description: Author and journalist Rachel Swaby discussed a few of the substantial contributions that women have made to science.

episodes.title: Elixir of Life -- Groks Science Show 2015-06-10
episodes.description: Chronic stress causes negative impacts to the brain but caffeine can help to mitigate these effects. On this program, Rodrigo Cunha discusses the relationship between caffeine, stress, emotions

episodes.title: AI Economy -- Groks Science Show 2015-06-03
episodes.description: Artificial intelligence and robotics will change the economy of the future.  On this episode, Kip Marlow discussed the economics of AI.

episodes.title: Tomorrowland -- Groks Science Show 2015-05-27
episodes.description: What will the future bring?  On this episode, Steven Kotler discusses how science fiction ideas have moved from the imagination of authors to real innovations that will impact our lives

episodes.title: The Future Earth -- Groks Science Show 2015-05-20
episodes.description: The countries of the world have not yet come to a global agreement on limiting the greenhouse gases climate change. On this program, Nobel Laureate Yuan T. Lee discusses the Future Earth program.

episodes.title: Tau or Beta -- Groks Science Show 2015-05-13
episodes.description: Despite years of research, we still do not understand much about the actual development of Alzheimers disease. On this episode, Dr. Melissa Murray joins us to discuss some of the recent research implicating two different proteins, tau and beta-amyloid.

episodes.title: The Monkey Dance -- Groks Science Show 2015-05-06
episodes.description: Millions of people paid to watch the Mayweather Pacquiao boxing match. Why? On this episode, we talk with English professor and cage fighter Dr. Jonathan Gottschall.

episodes.title: Gene Therapy Plan -- Groks Science Show 2015-04-29
episodes.description: What is epigenetics and how can our lifestyle influence the expression of our genes?  On this episode, Dr. Mitchell L. Gaynor discussed the gene therapy plan.

episodes.title: Snowball Mystery -- Groks Science Show 2015-04-22
episodes.description: In different earth periods, scientists have speculated that the planet was covered in glacier. On this program, Daniel Herwartz shows how the past climate can be reconstructed through oxygen isotope analysis.

episodes.title: Galileo Middle Finger -- Groks Science Show 2015-04-15
episodes.description: In their pursuit of truth and understanding of the natural world, scientists have been known to step on some toes. On this episode, Professor Alice Dreger discussed the conflicts between social justice activists and scientists.

episodes.title: 3D Supercapacitors -- Groks Science Show 2015-04-08
episodes.description: Affordable and efficient energy storage is the holy grail of energy technology. On this program, Maher El-Kady discussed the science and synthesis of graphene based storage devices.

episodes.title: Vitamania -- Groks Science Show 2015-04-01
episodes.description: Have you ever wondered if it is okay to get all 13 essential vitamins from a gummy bear? On this episode, Catherine Price discussed the history of American confusion and obsession with vitamins.

episodes.title: Child Development Myths -- Groks Science Show 2015-03-25
episodes.description: Parenting is a daunting task, but separating science from pseudo-science in child rearing is even more challenging.  On this episode, Dr. Stephen Hupp dispelled the great myths of child development.

episodes.title: Treating the Individual -- Groks Science Show 2015-03-18
episodes.description: Advances in genomics are allowing us to see how a person and DNA interacts with their environment and lifestyle to influence his or her health. On this episode, Dr. Eric Green discussed genomic technology and precision medicine.

episodes.title: Tumor Detection-- Groks Science Show 2015-03-11
episodes.description: While medical advances have helped to overcome many life threatening illnesses, cancer still strikes fear in many. On this episode, Sanjiv Gambir discusses the detection of tumor cells using blood sampling.

episodes.title: Sex Differences in Brain -- Groks Science Show 2015-03-04
episodes.description: That male and female brains are wired differently is simultaneously well-accepted and controversial. On this episode, Dr. Ruben Gur discussed functional and anatomical sex differences in the brain.

episodes.title: The Conversation -- Groks Science Show 2015-02-25
episodes.description: End of life care is rarely discussed, although it is perhaps one of the most important conversations that one must have.  On this episode, Dr. Angelo Volandes discussed end-of-life medical care.

episodes.title: Football Physics -- Groks Science Show 2015-02-18
episodes.description: Professional football players today play a highly regulated game, but the toughest rules of all are the laws of physics. On this episode, Dr. Timothy Gay discusses the physics of football.

episodes.title: The X-Men -- Groks Science Show 2015-02-11
episodes.description: X-rays have come a long way. On this program, Janos Hajdu and Thomas Eckberg, discuss the latest frontier in x-ray imaging.

episodes.title: Hormones in Prostate Cancer -- Groks Science Show 2015-02-04
episodes.description: Prostate cancer is the second leading cause of cancer mortality in American men. On this episode, Edwin Reyes tells us about the role of the androgen receptor in circulating tumor cells.

episodes.title: Touch -- Groks Science Show 2015-01-28
episodes.description: Touch is a sensation that may be overlooked, but is essential to our development, everyday language, and emotional well-being.  On this episode, Prof. David Linden discussed the neuroscience of touch.

episodes.title: Quantum Moment -- Groks Science Show 2015-01-21
episodes.description: Since the theory of quantum mechanics became accepted, we have  been living in a world of quantum leaps. On this episode, Dr. Robert Crease discussed how terms from quantum mechanics found their way into everyday discourse.

episodes.title: Rational Bargaining -- Groks Science Show 2015-01-14
episodes.description: A prevailing notion of economics is that individuals act rationally and in their own self-interest. Research has recently shown that this is not necessarily the case. On this program, David Victor discusses how experience affects negotiation tactics

episodes.title: Dr Krinsky goes to Washington -- Groks Science Show 2015-01-07
episodes.description: Can we make government more friendly to science and technology? Yes we can. On this episode, Dr. Benjamin Krinsky discusses affecting scientific policy

episodes.title: Time Finder -- Groks Science Show 2014-12-31
episodes.description: Finding time to accomplish tasks can be a challenge.  On this episode, Mitzi Weinman discussed strategies for personal management.

episodes.title: Longest Threads -- Groks Science Show 2014-12-24
episodes.description: The excitement surrounding the advances in physics can be more difficult to convey than the actual advances themselves.  On this episode, Tasneem Zehra Husain discussed the exciting threads weaving through the history of physics.

episodes.title: Beauty Premium -- Groks Science Show 2014-12-17
episodes.description: What drives the beauty premium effect? On this episode, Jaclyn Wong discussed recent studies aimed at answering these question.

episodes.title: All Tangled Up -- Groks Science Show 2014-12-03
episodes.description: Particle entanglement is a strange prediction of quantum mechanics. On this episode, Dr. Jason Gallicchio discussed particle entanglement, quasars, and more.

episodes.title: Satirical Nation -- Groks Science Show 2014-11-26
episodes.description: Satirical commentary on public events is nothing new, but now may be a greater force in shaping modern discourse.  On this episode, Sophia McClennen discussed how satire is saving the nation.

episodes.title: The Imitation Game -- Groks Science Show 2014-11-19
episodes.description: Alan Turing was one of the most influential mathematicians in the development of computer science and artificial intelligence. On the episode, Dr. Barry Cooper discussed the life and work of Turing.

episodes.title: Communicating Uncertainty -- Groks Science Show 2014-11-12
episodes.description: Science is based on accepting uncertainties. In contrast, business and politics tend to aver the unknown. On this program, Baruch Fischoff discusses how scientists can improve communicating risks and uncertainties.

episodes.title: Mars Rover Curiosity -- Groks Science Show 2014-11-05
episodes.description: Curiosity is the name of the Mars rover that has recently begun exploring the red planet for signs of past habitability.  On this episode, Rob Manning discussed the challenges of constructing the rover.

episodes.title: Age of Opportunity -- Groks Science Show 2014-10-29
episodes.description: While a select few remember their adolescent years fondly, most of us want to pretend they never happened. On this episode, Laurence Steinberg discussed the neuroscience of adolescence.

episodes.title: Arrival of the Fittest -- Groks Science Show 2014-10-22
episodes.description: The theory of evolution explains how the fittest traits survive in a species, but not how those traits arise in the first place.  On this episode, Andreas Wagner discussed the arrival of the fittest.

episodes.title: Nose Knows -- Groks Science Show 2014-10-15
episodes.description: Olfaction plays an important role in our lives. On this episode, David Kern discusses how the loss of smell can predict impending death and affect our love life.

episodes.title: Mantle Plumes -- Groks Science Show 2014-10-08
episodes.description: According to plate tectonics, volcanoes arise where two plates meet. However, volcano chains like those that form the Hawaii islands occur in the middle of the plates. On this program, Gillian Foulger discusses current theories in intraplate volcano sites.

episodes.title: Eruption Changed World -- Groks Science Show 2014-10-01
episodes.description: The 1815 eruption of Mount Tambora precipitated three years of dramatic global events that are only now being traced to the eruption. On this episode, Dr. Gillen Wood discuss the effects of this eruption.

episodes.title: Trauma Healing -- Groks Science Show 2014-09-24
episodes.description: Mental trauma is a growing issue in society, yet current treatments may not be addressing the issue.  On this program, Dr. Bessel van der Kolk discussed new methods for healing mental trauma.

episodes.title: Ebola Science Politics -- Groks Science Show 2014-09-17
episodes.description: The Ebola virus has been making headlines since the spread of the virus in West Africa.  On this episode, Dr. Brenda Wilson discussed the Ebola virus.

episodes.title: Nano Nano -- Groks Science Show 2014-09-10
episodes.description: Bulk carbon comes in many different forms from pencil lead to diamonds. At the nanoscopic level, the properties become even more exotic. On this program, Hari Manoharan talks about what happens when nanostructures of carbon are combined.

episodes.title: End of Absence -- Groks Science Show 2014-09-03
episodes.description: Advances in technology have changed the way we work, the way we socialize, and the way we learn. On this episode, Michael Harris discusses what constant connectedness means for the well being of future generations.

episodes.title: Saving Normal -- Groks Science Show 2014-08-27
episodes.description: The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM) has far reaching influence beyond that of psychiatric diagnosis.  On this episode, Dr. Allen Frances discussed saving normal.

episodes.title: Once More with Feeling -- Groks Science Show 2014-08-20
episodes.description: This episode we speak with neuroscientist Dr. Sliman Bensmaia. He tells us about his research on touch, how our hands feel, how our brains process this information, and how this research is being used to design better prostheses.

episodes.title: Bitcoins -- Groks Science Show 2014-08-13
episodes.description: Can a digitally encrypted currency uproot the financial institutions of the world?  On this episode, Jimmy Homma discusses bitcoins.

episodes.title: Human Animal Bond -- Groks Science Show 2014-08-06
episodes.description: We do a lot for our pets and often even treat them like family members. But, they are paying us back by improving our health. On this episode, Dr. Alan Beck, Director of the Center for the Human-Animal Bond at Purdue University discussed the effect that animals have on the physical and psychological well being of the people they spend time with.

episodes.title: Crowded Planet -- Groks Science Show 2014-07-30
episodes.description: Overpopulation affects not only humans but also wildlife.  On this episode, Stephanie Feldstein discussed the crowded planet.

episodes.title: Health Care Data -- Groks Science Show 2014-07-23
episodes.description: Health care data is increasingly vulnerable to hackers.  On this episode, Paul Oster discussed protecting health care data.

episodes.title: Improving Health with Cats and Dogs -- Groks Science Show 2014-07-16
episodes.description: Cats and dogs are companions, protectors, and health improvers?  Recent studies show that cats and dogs may benefit us in ways that go beyond companionship. On this episode, we discuss research findings that show how these animals can boost our health.

episodes.title: Ice Ice -- Groks Science Show 2014-07-09
episodes.description: Water is fundamental to all life but little is actually known about its inter-molecular dynamics and structures. On this program, Anders Nilsson talks about the frontiers of water science.

episodes.title: Precision Medicine -- Groks Science Show 2014-07-02
episodes.description: How much can our own genetics determine the diagnosis of our illness or determine the course of treatment? On this episode, we discuss precision medicine and the role of women in this rapidly developing field.

episodes.title: Colliding Worlds -- Groks Science Show 2014-06-25
episodes.description: Science and art may seem like widely divergent fields of human endeavor, but advances in science are now influencing contemporary art. On this program, Arthur I. Miller discussed the colliding worlds of science and art.

episodes.title: Cosmic Cocktail -- Groks Science Show 2014-06-18
episodes.description: Physicists tell us that the normal matter is not the majority of the matter that exists. On this episode, Dr. Katherine Freese discusses the mysterious nature of dark matter and dark energy.

episodes.title: Crouching Tiger -- Groks Science Show 2014-06-11
episodes.description: Why do many Asian American youths excel academically? On this program, Dr. Amy Hsin discusses the factors that underlie the academic success of certain ethnicities.

episodes.title: Console Wars -- Groks Science Show 2014-06-04
episodes.description: Video games are a huge part of the lives of countless kids and adults alike. On this episode, Blake Harris discusses the history of the video game industry.

episodes.title: Besting the Pests -- Groks Science Show 2014-05-21
episodes.description: No one likes getting sick, not even plants. On this episode, Talia Karasov explains her research on how plants and pathogens coevolve and the possible implications that this work might have on crop science.

episodes.title: Earth Sciences -- Groks Science Show 2014-05-14
episodes.description: Are modern technologies the best? What are some traditional methods we should preserve? On this episode, we discussed earth sciences, natural disaster, fortran, and water purification with the man on the street.

episodes.title: Your Genes Your Brain -- Groks Science Show 2014-05-07
episodes.description: Genes influence personality and risk for psychiatric disorders. On this episode, Dr. Abraham Palmer discussed psychiatric genetics.

episodes.title: Cannabis Brain -- Groks Science Show 2014-04-30
episodes.description: Does marijuana affect the brain? What is the scientific evidence? On this episode, Dr. Anne Speckhard discussed marijuana use and the brain.

episodes.title: Missing Microbes -- Groks Science Show 2014-04-23
episodes.description: Innovations in modern society have created several benefits to human health, but they may have also created changes to human development. On this episode, Dr. Martin Blaser discussed changes to the human microbiome.

episodes.title: Extreme Life of the Sea -- Groks Science Show 2014-04-16
episodes.description: Dr. Stephen Palumbi talks about his book, The Extreme Life of the Sea, on the fastest, oldest, and smallest creatures that live in the coldest, hottest, and deepest parts of the ocean.

episodes.title: One Percent Inspiration -- Groks Science Show 2014-04-09
episodes.description: The barriers to inventing and tinkering keep falling as computers become more powerful and 3D printing becomes ubiquitous. On this episode, Tracy McSheery discusses the opportunities for entrepreneurship.

episodes.title: Mind Reading-- Groks Science Show 2014-04-02
episodes.description: We constantly making inferences about the thoughts and beliefs of others but how often do we get it right? On this episode, Dr. Nicholas Epley, professor at the University of Chicago's Booth School of Business discusses Mindwise.

episodes.title: Mindless -- Groks Science Show 2014-03-26
episodes.description: Computer business systems have been designed to streamline and increase productivity in various organizations. But, have these systems been implemented appropriately? On this episode, Simon Head discussed why smarter machines are making dumber humans.

episodes.title: Sea Change -- Groks Science Show 2014-03-19
episodes.description: The ocean is changing rapidly. Sophie McCoy explains her research on how these changes are affecting the marine ecosystems in the Pacific Northwest.

episodes.title: Investigating Happy Minds -- Groks Science Show 2014-03-12
episodes.description: Most people would agree that a biological understanding of mental illness is an important effort. On this episode, Dr. Richard Davidson discussed positive states of mind.

episodes.title: Making Labs Happy -- Groks Science Show 2014-03-05
episodes.description: Why do lab supplies cost so much? Is there a way to make science more efficient? On this episode, Tom Ruginis discussed improving the happiness of scientists and the quality of their research.

episodes.title: Wizard of Menlo Park -- Groks Science Show 2014-02-26
episodes.description: Thomas Edison is widely regarded as one of the greatest inventors. His influences on industry and technology remain with us today. On this episode, Leonard DeGraaf discussed the life and works of Thomas Edison.

episodes.title: Planet of the Apes -- Groks Science Show 2014-02-19
episodes.description: What can our closest living relatives, great apes like the chimpanzee and bonobo, teach us about ourselves? On this episode, Dale Peterson joins us to discuss these fascinating, yet sadly endangered, animals.

episodes.title: Neutrino Hunters -- Groks Science Show 2014-02-12
episodes.description: Trillions of subatomic particles called neutrinos are zipping through our bodies every second of every day. On this episode, Dr. Ray Jayawardhana discussed the hunt for neutrinos.

episodes.title: Seahorses and Jellyfish -- Groks Science Show 2014-02-05
episodes.description: Dr. Brad Gemmell gives us a glimpse into the secret predatory lives of seahorses, and describes how we are getting ideas from the anatomy of the jellyfish for designing vehicles for water and air travel.

episodes.title: Monkey Voyage -- Groks Science Show 2014-01-29
episodes.description: How do the species of the world wind up in their geographical locations? On this episode, Prof. Alan De Queiroz discusses ocean crossings and speciation.

episodes.title: Mathematical Universe -- Groks Science Show 2014-01-22
episodes.description: What is the nature of reality? And, how can math provide the answers? On this program, Prof. Max Tegmark discussed the ultimate nature of reality.

episodes.title: Evolution of the Eye -- Groks Science Show 2014-01-15
episodes.description: The wide array of eye designs in the animal kingdom reflects the critical role that sight plays in the well-being of an animal. On this episode, Dr. Ivan Schwab tells us the story of eye evolution.

episodes.title: Chasing Shackleton -- Groks Science Show 2014-01-08
episodes.description: Sir Ernest Shackleton and his journey to Antartica is best known for the heroic and epic tale of survival that ensued following the initial disasters that were encountered. On this program, Tim Jarvis discussed recreating this epic voyage of survival.

episodes.title: BRAIN Initiative -- Groks Science Show 2014-01-01
episodes.description: What is the BRAIN initiative?  On this episode, neuroscientist Partha Mitra, offers background and insight.

episodes.title: 10K Year Feast -- Groks Science Show 2013-12-25
episodes.description: Are current trends in food production and consumption sustainable? On this episode, Junko Habu discusses findings from the Jomon civilization and its implications for global climate change.

episodes.title: The Gap -- Groks Science Show 2013-12-11
episodes.description: Humans seem very distinct from other animals, but what is it about the human mind that truly defines as uniquely human? On this episode, Prof. Thomas Suddendorf discussed the gap between humans and other animals.

episodes.title: Paneled Mind -- Groks Science Show 2013-12-04
episodes.description: Dr. Dwayne Godwin contributes regularly to Scientific American in the form of neuroscience comics. On this episode, he discusses his creative process and goals for the series.

episodes.title: Countdown -- Groks Science Show 2013-11-27
episodes.description: The population of the world continues to grow, but can the earth sustain it? On this program, Alan Weisman discussed sustainable population growth.

episodes.title: Discovering Bird Species -- Groks Science Show 2013-11-20
episodes.description: Evolution has created a wide range of bird species, many of which have not been characterized.  On this episode, Ben Winger discusses his research on how new species of birds evolve and his work in the Peruvian cloud forests

episodes.title: Everything Pill -- Groks Science Show 2013-11-13
episodes.description: The range of mental conditions is part of daily life, but at what point do downturns become pathological? On this program, Dr. Steven Walker discussed weighing therapy and pharmaceutical treatments for mental conditions.

episodes.title: Space Robots -- Groks Science Show 2013-11-06
episodes.description: We have learned a great deal about the surface of Mars, the moons of Saturn, and the origins of our universe. On this episode, Chris Impey discussed unmanned space exploration of distant worlds.

episodes.title: Kivalina Climate Change -- Groks Science Show 2013-10-30
episodes.description: Climate change often seems massive, yet remote. However, the impacts are being felt around the globe. On this program, Elizabeth Gaylynn Baker discussed the impact of climate change.

episodes.title: Love and Math -- Groks Science Show 2013-10-23
episodes.description: The subject of mathematics often seems dry and removed from reality. On this episode, Prof. Edward Frenkel discussed the hidden reality of math and the Langlands program.

episodes.title: Brain Plasticity -- Groks Science Show 2013-10-16
episodes.description: Brain plasticity happens not only early in life but also in adulthood, as well as in response to traumatic brain injury. On this episode, Dr. Michael Merzenich discussed the biology of brain plasticity.

episodes.title: Science of Oakland -- Groks Science Show 2013-10-09
episodes.description: What happens when old friends meet again? Wildness ensues. On this episode, our man on the street Vikram Kulkarni, joins us to talk about the science of Oakland.

episodes.title: Relaxation through Neurogenesis -- Groks Science Show 2013-10-02
episodes.description: Anxiety disorders are a part of life for people around the world, but there has been a revolution in our understanding of these disorders.  Dr. Mazen Kheirbek discusses anxiety disorders, adult neurogenesis, and the hippocampus.

episodes.title: Rational Animal -- Groks Science Show 2013-09-25
episodes.description: Human behavior is often viewed as being eminently rational. However, modern psychology has shown that behavior is often guided more by evolutionary constraints. On this program, Prof. Douglas T. Kenrick discussed the evolutionary basis of human thinking.

episodes.title: Universe Verse -- Groks Science Show 2013-09-11
episodes.description: As the internet expands, the barriers to spreading scientific knowledge falls. Yet, there is never enough science education. On this program, James Dunbar talks about the Universe Verse

episodes.title: Self-Driving Cars -- Groks Science Show 2013-09-04
episodes.description: Several car companies promising to release nearly self driving cars in the next decade. On this episode, Dr. Steve Underwood discusses self driving cars.

episodes.title: Fracking -- Groks Science Show 2013-08-28
episodes.description: Hydraulic fracturing, or fracking, has been lauded as the solution to the peak oil problem, and will provide hundreds of years of cheap energy. But, the reality is very different. On this program, Richard Heinberg discussed the false promises of franking.

episodes.title: Octopus Garden -- Groks Science Show 2013-08-21
episodes.description: You might think that sharks are the strangest animals in the ocean. In fact, they have so many peculiarities that they seem almost alien! On this episode, biologists Carrie Albertin and Judit Pungor discussed these bizarre and wonderful animals.

episodes.title: Theory of Almost Everything -- Groks Science Show 2013-08-14
episodes.description: The Standard Model aims to explain phenomena of the very small and the very large. Yet, not quite everything in the universe can be explained by it. On this program, Thomas Buckholtz discussed complementary mathematics to bridge gaps in the Standard Model.

episodes.title: Better Open -- Groks Science Show 2013-08-07
episodes.description: Most scientific articles are not published in open access journals. On this program, Dr. Patrick Brown and Dr. Michael Eisen discussed the state of the publishing system, the shift towards open access, and the story of PLoS.

episodes.title: Critical Thinking -- Groks Science Show 2013-07-31
episodes.description: Although critical thinking is essential for effective communication and problem solving, the techniques for critical thinking are often not employed effectively. On this program, Dr. Linda Elder discussed how to think critically.

episodes.title: Sudden Wealth Syndrome -- Groks Science Show 2013-07-24
episodes.description: Sudden wealth can be a blessing and a curse, especially if the wealth is mismanaged. On this episode, Mr. Irvin Schorsch discussed dealing with sudden wealth syndrome.

episodes.title: Fossil Lake -- Groks Science Show 2013-07-17
episodes.description: Fossil Lake is a fascinating place in terms of the insight it gives us into communities of long extinct animals. On this episode, Dr. Lance Grande discussed his new book, The Lost World of Fossil Lake.

episodes.title: Zap Em -- Groks Science Show 2013-07-10
episodes.description: Exposure to radiation gave us Spiderman and the Incredible Hulk but what really happens when people are exposed to it? On this program, Dr. Charles Limoli discusses radiation and brain cells.

episodes.title: Age of Ivory -- Groks Science Show 2013-07-03
episodes.description: Less than a half a million African elephants live in the wild and more than 25,000 of those are poached every year. On this episode, Dr. Kevin Uno discussed carbon, ecology, elephants, and conservation

episodes.title: Doing It -- Groks Science Show 2013-06-26
episodes.description: Although sex is an integral part of human existence, there is still that most of us are in the dark about. On this program, Dr. Robert Martin discussed the evolution of sexual behaviors in humans.

episodes.title: Helping Oysters -- Groks Science Show 2013-06-19
episodes.description: Oysters face an ocean of difficulty but offer us a world of good. Dr. George Waldbusser joins us to discuss oysters and his work concerning the effects of ocean acidification on oyster development.

episodes.title: Sink Mystery -- Groks Science Show 2013-06-12
episodes.description: They surround us. They live in us. They are bacteria. Some cause diseases, others produce cheese.  On this program, Jeffrey McLean discusses the genomic sequencing of bacteria.

episodes.title: Return to Sender -- Groks Science Show 2013-06-05
episodes.description: Ken Weiss has some of the most controversial samples in all of anthropology. Dr. Weiss joined us to discuss the controversy surrounding these samples and the enormous difficulty with returning these samples to the Yanomami.

episodes.title: Terminated -- Groks Science Show 2013-05-29
episodes.description: The rapid increases in the processing power of computers is heralding a brave new world where jobs will be completely automated. On this program, Kevin Drum discussed the economics of a robotic future.

episodes.title: Universe Ticket -- Groks Science Show 2013-05-22
episodes.description: The universe is a very large place and it often helps to have a guide. On this episode, Megan Watzke discussed a guide to the cosmos.

episodes.title: Changing Dinosaurs -- Groks Science Show 2013-05-15
episodes.description: The dinosaurs of our childhood have changed so much over the years.  On this episode, science writer Brian Switek discussed his new book, My Beloved Brontosaurus.

episodes.title: Canary in Coal Mine -- Groks Science Show 2013-05-08
episodes.description: The natural disasters that small islands face are regarded as the canary in a coal mine on the issue of global climate change. On this program, John Hay discussed the importance small island countries.

episodes.title: Science of Longevity -- Groks Science Show 2013-05-01
episodes.description: Who doesn't want to live a longer, healthier life? What can a laboratory worm, the nematode, teach us about longevity? On this episode, Professor Ted Anton joins us to discuss The Longevity Seekers.

episodes.title: Alimentary Adventures -- Groks Science Show 2013-04-24
episodes.description: The alimentary canal is a structure that most would rather not explore to deeply, metaphorically or literally. Yet, on this program, Mary Roach discussed her adventures through the alimentary canal.

episodes.title: Paleofantasy -- Groks Science Show 2013-04-17
episodes.description: We are constantly compelled to fit what we know, or think we know, about the past into some kind of narrative, which are sometimes wrong. On this episode, Dr. Marlene Zuk discusses her book, Paleofantasies.

episodes.title: Social Network -- Groks Science Show 2013-04-10
episodes.description: Are social networks a good way to mobilize masses of people from around the globe for a common cause? On this program, Alex Rutherford talks about locating balloons through the DARPA Network Challenge using social networks.

episodes.title: Euclidean Space -- Groks Science Show 2013-04-03
episodes.description: Euclidean geometry seems fundamental to the way the world operates, so much so that we often take for granted its basic tenets. On this program, Dr. David Berlinski discussed his book, The King of Infinite Space: Euclid and His Elements.

episodes.title: Frankenstein Cat -- Groks Science Show 2013-03-27
episodes.description: Bioengineering is changing the way we think about the nature of biology. What do the advances in biotechnology mean for the future? On this program, Emily Anthes discussed bioengineering and her book, Frankensteins Cat.

episodes.title: Weather Maths -- Groks Science Show 2013-03-20
episodes.description: Humans have wanted to know the weather tomorrow for as long as there have been todays. On this program, Dr. Ian Roulstone discussed Invisible in the Storm: The Role of Mathematics in Understanding Weather.

episodes.title: Sleep Diet -- Groks Science Show 2013-03-13
episodes.description: Americans eat too much. They drink too much. They just about do everything in excess, except sleep. On this program, Prof. Kenneth Wright discussed how lack of sleep influences our metabolism and its effect on weight gain.

episodes.title: Cosmos Within Us -- Groks Science Show 2013-03-06
episodes.description: Where did the atoms in our bodies come from? How did Jupiter shape the evolution of life on Earth? And, how do you make an apple pie from scratch? On this episode, evolutionary biologist and paleontologist Neil Shubin discussed The Universe Within.

episodes.title: Physics in Mind -- Groks Science Show 2013-02-27
episodes.description: How does a biological system, like the brain, give rise to an emergent property, like the mind? Can quantum physics provide the answers? On this program, Prof. Werner R. Lowenstein discussed physics in mind.

episodes.title: Ballooning to the Stars -- Groks Science Show 2013-02-20
episodes.description: Astrophysicist experiments can involve attaching expensive, heavy telescopes to giant helium balloons.  Surprisingly, this is one of the most effective ways to study how stars are born. Tristan Matthews described his recent experiments in Antarctica.

episodes.title: Oxygen the Menace -- Groks Science Show 2013-02-13
episodes.description: Our current biosphere depends on oxygen to live but that was not always true. On this show, Joe Kirschvink discusses the visciousness of oxygen, the evolution of cyanobacteria, and the Medea hypothesis.

episodes.title: Digging Peromyscus -- Groks Science Show 2013-02-06
episodes.description: Not many laboratories house mice in 3000 pounds of sand, but then not many labs research the burrowing habits of Peromyscus, either. Dr. Hopi Hoekstra discussed oldfield and deer mice.

episodes.title: Starch Solution -- Groks Science Show 2013-01-30
episodes.description: What is the cause of the current epidemic obesity and can a starch diet be of benefit? On this program, Dr. John McDougall discussed the starch solution.

episodes.title: Humanistic Psychology -- Groks Science Show 2013-01-23
episodes.description: What are the roots of our current psychological notions of individuality and the inner self? On this program, Dr. Jessica Grogan discussed the history of humanistic psychology.

episodes.title: Jack and the Microbiome -- Groks Science Show 2013-01-16
episodes.description: Bacteria are everywhere.  How do you study the microbiome? On this episode, microbial ecologist Jack Gilbert discussed the Earth Microbiome Project.

episodes.title: Web 2.0 -- Groks Science Show 2013-01-09
episodes.description: What does it take for a website to keep growing? What makes a social network sticky? On this program, Terry Chay discusses social networks, viral marketing, and the Obama campaign.

episodes.title: Fire and Wire -- Groks Science Show 2013-01-02
episodes.description: There may be 20 billion neurons in your brain but that is not nearly enough to allow each cell to hold its own unique bit of information.   On this program, Dr. Jason MacLean joined us to discuss Hebbian plasticity and the past, present, and future of research on neuronal networks.

episodes.title: Spillover -- Groks Science Show 2012-12-26
episodes.description: The threat of a global pandemic resulting from a disease crossing over from animals to humans has become more likely in the hyperconnected world of today. On this episode, David Quammen discussed animal infections and the next human pandemic.

episodes.title: Brain Scans -- Groks Science Show 2012-12-19
episodes.description: What can scientists learn from brain scans, and how can they avoid the Four Horsemen of the Brainscanpocalypse? Dr. Dorothy Bishop joins us to discuss the potential, and potential problems, of studies involving fMRI or other brain scanning techniques.

episodes.title: Truth Freedom -- Groks Science Show 2012-12-12
episodes.description: Is the scientific enterprise driven by the truth or by social good? How should the truth inform our world view? On this program, Terry Chay discussed the relationship between science and social activism, and the open web.

episodes.title: Two Plus Two -- Groks Science Show 2012-12-05
episodes.description: Why are some scientific discoveries, like the geologic age of the Earth, discounted by so many people? On this episode, Dr. Phil Plait discusses how science is presented in the media and why people sometimes believe very strange things.

episodes.title: Singularity Economics -- Groks Science Show 2012-11-28
episodes.description: The technological singularity is the idea of a vast increase in intelligence arising from technological advances. How will such a singularity affect global economics? On this program, Prof. James D. Miller discussed the economic impacts of a technological singularity.

episodes.title: Molecular Origami -- Groks Science Show 2012-11-21
episodes.description: Protein folding is an incredibly complex problem. To solve it, scientists use super computers and even online video games. On this episode, University of Chicago biophysicist Tobin Sosnick joins us to discuss this fascinating and confounding biological problem.

episodes.title: There Will Be Blood -- Groks Science Show 2012-11-14
episodes.description: Why do humans have blood types? On this program, Laure Segurel talks about her work in finding out the origins of the ABO blood type. Alexei Kitaev also joins us to talk about quantum computing error correction.

episodes.title: Life at Bletchley Park -- Groks Science Show 2012-11-07
episodes.description: Bletchley Park was the center of code breaking in the United Kingdom during World War II. On this program, Sinclair McKay joins us to discuss his book, The Secret Life of Bletchley Park.

episodes.title: Psychopathic Wisdom -- Groks Science Show 2012-10-31
episodes.description: Psychopaths often conjure images of characters like Hannibal Lecter, cool and charismatic, yet violently brutal. But, are there traits that psychopaths have that could be beneficial in daily life? On this episode, Dr. Kevin Dutton discussed the wisdom of psychopaths.

episodes.title: Scientific Philosophy -- Groks Science Show 2012-10-24
episodes.description: What can science tell us about the weighty philosophical questions in life? Can science and philosophy be combined? On this program, Prof. Massimo Pigliucci discusses the combination of science and philosophy.

episodes.title: Sobremesa -- Groks Science Show 2012-10-17
episodes.description: Have you ever wanted to try the universal translator on Star Trek? Would it make it easier to communicate with people who speak other languages? On this episode, Nataly Kelly discusses her new book, Found in Translation.

episodes.title: Climate Poker -- Groks Science Show 2012-10-10
episodes.description: Nature does not bluff but she also does not show her cards readily. That is at the root of the climate problem. On this program, Dr. Scott Barrett gives an overview of the international climate regime to reduce greenhouse gases and explains how uncertainty in climate predictions hamper negotiations.

episodes.title: Ponderables -- Groks Science Show 2012-10-03
episodes.description: Several recent books walk the reader through human history by describing the history of specific objects or commodities such as salt, cod, coffee, and even the lowly toothpick.  In this episode, Tom Jackson discusses his new series of books, Ponderables.

episodes.title: Concussions -- Groks Science Show 2012-09-26
episodes.description: Concussions are a serious issue among athletes and can be even more serious for young athletes. On this program, Dr. Robert Cantu discussed recognizing and treating concussions in young athletes.

episodes.title: Brilliantly Broken -- Groks Science Show 2012-09-19
episodes.description: Certain individuals with developmental disorders such as autism sometimes develop remarkable musical, mathematical, or artistic abilities. Psychiatrist Dr. Darold Treffert, an expert on the savant syndrome, joins us to discuss this fascinating condition.

episodes.title: Salty Clouds -- Groks Science Show 2012-09-12
episodes.description: Particulates in the air act as nucleation sites for the formation of rain clouds. But what are they made of? On this episode, Dr. Mary Gilles discussed their discovery of potassium salts and fungi as seeds for clouds.

episodes.title: PhD Value -- Groks Science Show 2012-09-05
episodes.description: Is a PhD in science a good idea? And do graduate programs give students the tools necessary to help PhDs in science capitalize on good ideas? Dan Lametti, Jennifer Dugas-Ford, Yelena Grinberg, and Aya Pusic share their thoughts.

episodes.title: Gravity Engine -- Groks Science Show 2012-08-29
episodes.description: What can super-massive black holes tell us about the structure of our galaxy and the universe?  On this program, Dr. Caleb Scharf discusses astrophysics and black holes.

episodes.title: End-Devonian Extinction -- Groks Science Show 2012-08-22
episodes.description: Have you ever wondered how structures like limbs and jaws evolved? Paleontologist Michael Coates joins us to discuss how the devastating End-Devonian extinction impacted vertebrate life on Earth.

episodes.title: Back Pain -- Groks Science Show 2012-08-15
episodes.description: Back pain is a common health issue, but one that most will endure rather than treat. On this program, Dr. Julie Silver discussed treating back pain.

episodes.title: Drill Baby Drill -- Groks Science Show 2012-08-08
episodes.description: For ages, earthquakes were thought to under the control of the divine. But what happens when massive amounts of fluid is injected into the ground? In this program, Dr. Cliff Frohlich join us to talk about human induced tremors.

episodes.title: Thrive among disruption -- Groks Science Show 2012-08-01
episodes.description: We can't always forecast what difficulties lie ahead but we can prepare ourselves to thrive despite these challenges. Andrew Zolli joins us to discuss his new book Resiliency: How Things Bounce Back.

episodes.title: Einsteins Jewish Science -- Groks Science Show 2012-07-25
episodes.description: The theory of relativity is a landmark in modern physics, but one that can not be divorced from the socio-political climate of its time. On this program, Dr. Steven Gimbel discusses Einsteins Jewish Science: Physics at the intersection of politics and religion.

episodes.title: Darwinian Agriculture -- Groks Science Show 2012-07-18
episodes.description: How can understanding Darwins theory of natural selection help us feed the planet? Dr. R. Ford Denison joins us to discuss his new book, Darwinian Agriculture: How Understanding Evolution Can Improve Agriculture.

episodes.title: Higgs Boson -- Groks Science Show 2012-07-11
episodes.description: What research paper has 2500 authors on it? The one for the Higgs Boson! Dr. Ian Hinchliffe talks about the science of this elusive particle and the enormous effort that went into detecting it.

episodes.title: Lab in a Fishbowl -- Groks Science Show 2012-07-04
episodes.description: Have you ever had the feeling that you're being watched? Dr. Julie Horvath from the Nature Research Center at the North Carolina Museum of Natural Sciences has that feeling every day.  She and her lab are in the middle of a museum and viewable to the thousands of people who pass by every day. We talk to Dr. Horvath about her work, her lab, and how the Nature Research Center inspires and educates.

episodes.title: Infectious Behavior -- Groks Science Show 2012-06-27
episodes.description: What are the connections between the immune system and the brain? How could these interactions give rise to mental disorders, such as schizophrenia and autism? On this program, Prof. Paul H. Patterson discused Infectious Behavior.

episodes.title: Forever Fix -- Groks Science Show 2012-06-20
episodes.description: Fifteen years ago, gene therapy was a promising technology with the potential to revolutionize medicine. Since then some of that potential has been fulfilled but the path from the lab to the clinic has been bumpy. Dr. Ricki Lewis joins us to discuss that path and her new book, The Forever Fix.

episodes.title: Coyote City -- Groks Science Show 2012-06-13
episodes.description: Over the past 20 years, coyotes have been moving into large midwestern cities like Chicago. Dr. Stanley Gehrt, the Principal Investigator of the Cook County Coyote Project, joins us to discuss the fascinating biology of these wily, urban coyotes.

episodes.title: Population Bomb -- Groks Science Show 2012-06-06
episodes.description: The 20th century is marked by a dramatic increase in the global human population. But, can this go on? Will this lead to the collapse of civilization? On this program, Prof. Kentaka Aruga discussed the two main schools of thoughts on how the human population will progress.

episodes.title: Moral Origins -- Groks Science Show 2012-05-30
episodes.description: What are the origins of moral behaviors in humans? Did they spontaneously emerge or are there precursors in the natural history of human evolution? On this program, Prof. Richard Boehm discussed our moral origins.

episodes.title: Millenialism -- Groks Science Show 2012-05-23
episodes.description: A wide variety of apocalyptic prophecies and movements have occurred throughout history. But, what accounts for their continued emergence? On this program, Prof. Richard Landes discussed the history of millenial movements.

episodes.title: Talking Trash -- Groks Science Show 2012-05-16
episodes.description: What happens to our garbage after it leaves the bins behind out houses? Is all trash waste? Author and Pulitzer Prize winning journalist Ed Humes joins us to discuss, Garbology and Our Dirty Love Affair With Trash.

episodes.title: Migratory Birds -- Groks Science Show 2012-05-09
episodes.description: The Korean DMZ is an important location for the path of migratory birds. On this program, Dr. Hiroyoshi Higuchi talks about the use of satellite tracking for migratory birds and the cleverness of crows.

episodes.title: Your Inner Macaque -- Groks Science Show 2012-05-02
episodes.description: Have you ever noticed that people behave strangely in elevators? On this show, Dr. Dario Maestripieri discussed how studying the behavior of rhesus monkeys and other non-human primates can help us understand why humans act the way we do.

episodes.title: Fearless -- Groks Science Show 2012-04-25
episodes.description: Although change is often desired, it is not usually achieved without trepidation. On this program, Dr. Jonathan Alpert discussed being fearless.

episodes.title: Counting Without Language -- Groks Science Show 2012-04-18
episodes.description: Math and language may seem separate, but the two are remarkably intertwined.  On this program, Dr. Liesje Spaepen joins us to discuss how language shapes mathematical thought.

episodes.title: Equations -- Groks Science Show 2012-04-11
episodes.description: Mathematical equations often seem abstruse and disconnected from the real world, however many of these have changed the word we live in.  On this program, Prof. Ian Stewart discussed the equations that changed the world.

episodes.title: Technologists -- Groks Science Show 2012-04-04
episodes.description: Although technology rules modern life, the establishment of modern centers for technological education was not met without resistance. On this program, Matthew Pearl discussed the technologists.

episodes.title: Unconquered -- Groks Science Show 2012-03-28
episodes.description: The Amazon is one of the last unspoiled territories, where the indiginous tribes have remained largely untouched by modern civilization. On this program, Scott Wallace discussed the unconquered tribes of the Amazon.

episodes.title: Science of Mind -- Groks Science Show 2012-03-21
episodes.description: We all know a lot about psychology, but it turns out that what we know is mostly wrong. Dr. John Cacioppo joins us this week to discuss how to teach difficult psychological concepts in an engaging way to first year psychology students.

episodes.title: Bexarotene and Alzheimers -- Groks Science Show 2012-03-14
episodes.description: Alzheimers Disease is an unfortunate fact of life in our world today. But advancements in science and medicine may one day change that fact. Dr. Paige Cramer joins us to discuss a potential new Alzheimers treatment..

episodes.title: Brain Trust -- Groks Science Show 2012-03-07
episodes.description: Keeping up with the advances in science and technology can be daunting and it would help to have a brain trust. On this program, Garth Sundem discussed the Brain Trust.

episodes.title: Willpower Instinct -- Groks Science Show 2012-02-29
episodes.description: Although willpower is often viewed as a personality trait of great fortitude and resilience, new research is showing the neurobiological basis for willpower. On this program, Dr. Kelly McGonigal discussed the willpower instinct.

episodes.title: Dirty Minds -- Groks Science Show 2012-02-22
episodes.description: Why do we fall in love? What is it about the circuitry and neurochemistry of the brain that enables this behavior? On this program, Kayt Sukel discussed Diry Minds.

episodes.title: Bees and Eusocial Insects -- Groks Science Show 2012-02-15
episodes.description: It can be difficult to discern the impact of genes on behaviour from the effect of behaviour on genes. On this program Dr. Gene Robinson talks about using the honeybee and other eusocial insects to tease apart this web.

episodes.title: Walking Fish -- Groks Science Show 2012-02-08
episodes.description: Why would a fish have lungs and breathe air? What can a live fish tell us about the evolution of tetrapods? On this program, Heather King joins us to discuss how lungfish walk.

episodes.title: Health Care Reform -- Groks Science Show 2012-02-01
episodes.description: The Affordable Care Act continues to spur debate and confusion. What are the consequences of the health care reform act? On this program, Prof. Jonathan Gruber discussed health care reform.

episodes.title: Thinking Life -- Groks Science Show 2012-01-25
episodes.description: Is it possible to think deeply in an age of distraction? What are the pitfalls for ourselves and society to be driven to constant distraction? On this program, Prof. P.M. Forni discussed the thinking life.

episodes.title: Forgiveness -- Groks Science Show 2012-01-18
episodes.description: Forgiving is a difficult task, even for the most resolute individual. How can we cultivate a sense of forgiveness? On this program, Mary Hayes Grieco discussed forgiveness.

episodes.title: Empathy in Rats -- Groks Science Show 2012-01-11
episodes.description: Empathic motivations for pro-social behaviours are unique to humans, or are they? Dr. Peggy Mason joins us to discuss empathy and pro-social behaviour in rats.

episodes.title: Body Politic -- Groks Science Show 2012-01-04
episodes.description: Advances in biology have revolutionized modern medicine, but they have also spurred many ethical and political issues.  On this program, Prof. Jonathan Moreno discussed the politics of biology.

episodes.title: Electric Cars -- Groks Science Show 2011-12-28
episodes.description: The electric car has seen some fals starts, but new technical advances and changes to the global environment are propelling the adoption of these vehicles. On this program, Jim Motavalli discussed the new developments in the electric car.

episodes.title: Advocacy -- Groks Science Show 2011-12-21
episodes.description: Good ideas are often overlooked, while bad ideas may flouirsh. How does one insure that the best ideas are used? On this program, Prof. John Daly discussed the skills of advocacy.

episodes.title: Infinity Puzzle -- Groks Science Show 2011-12-14
episodes.description: Understanding the fundamental forces of nature is one of the hallmarks of modern physics. However, mathematically describing these forces often results in the emergence of infinities. On this program, Prof. Frank Close discussed the infinity puzzle.

episodes.title: Peacekeeping Economy -- Groks Science Show 2011-12-07
episodes.description: Although military might is often viewed as the primary method for national security, forging economic relationships may be more beneficial in the long run. On this program, Prof. Lloyd J. Dumas discussed the peacekeeping economy.

episodes.title: Mind Reading Ethics -- Groks Science Show 2011-11-30
episodes.description: Mind reading is not something we have to worry about in our daily lives, but the day when we do have that worry may be closer than we think. On this program, Paul Root Wolpe joined us to discuss why we should develop legal and ethical frameworks for dealing with mind reading sooner rather than later

episodes.title: Global Arms -- Groks Science Show 2011-11-23
episodes.description: The world of arms trading continues to affect global political and economic affairs. Yet, few investigations have delved into the shadowy and corrupt world of global arms trading. On this program, Andrew Feinstein discussed this shadow world.

episodes.title: Vonnegut -- Groks Science Show 2011-11-16
episodes.description: The literary world would be a much poorer place without the works of Kurt Vonnegut, but few know about the life story of the author himself. On this program, Charles J. Shields discussed the life and times of Kurt Vonnegut.

episodes.title: Gamification -- Groks Science Show 2011-11-02
episodes.description: What makes some applications more useable and enjoyable than others? Gamification is a method for improving the rewarding aspects of any application and changing behavior. On this program, Gabe Zichermann discussed gamification by design.

episodes.title: Technological Sport -- Groks Science Show 2011-10-26
episodes.description: Technology has changed all aspects of our lives, but perhaps underappreciated is the effect technological advances have on sports. On this program, John Greenburg discussed how technology is changing sport.

episodes.title: Plastic Oceans -- Groks Science Show 2011-10-19
episodes.description: Plastic debris has become a substantial threats to the oceans in the world. Where does this pollution originate and what can be done to stop it? On this program, Capt. Charles Moore discussed the pollution of the oceans by plastic.

episodes.title: Heavenly Physics -- Groks Science Show 2011-10-12
episodes.description: Modern physics may seem remote from our daily lives, yet the discoveries in the field have the potential to change how we view the world. On this program, Lisa Randall discussed how discoveries in modern physics shape the world around us.

episodes.title: Holy War -- Groks Science Show 2011-10-05
episodes.description: The expedition of Vasco Da Gama are often overshadowed by that of Columbus. But, these voyages perhaps more than those of Columbus changed the course of history. On this program, Nigel Cliff discussed how Vasco Da Gama turned the tide in a centuries-old clash of civilizations.

episodes.title: Attention -- Groks Science Show 2011-09-28
episodes.description: The rapid changes in technology are straining even those dedicated to their development. How can the science of attention change the way we live, learn and think with these new innovations? On this program, Prof. Cathy Davison discussed the brain science of attention.

episodes.title: Digital Division -- Groks Science Show 2011-09-21
episodes.description: Digital technology has revolutionized the modern world, but are there downsides to its influence on our personal lives and culture. On this program, Prof. Mark Bauerlein discussed the digital divide.

episodes.title: DASH Diet -- Groks Science Show 2011-09-14
episodes.description: High blood pressure and hypertension are major health problems, yet in many cases, diet ay be a better treatment than prescription medication. On this program, Marla Heller discussed the DASH diet action plan.

episodes.title: Infinite Beginnings -- Groks Science Show 2011-09-07
episodes.description: How are explanations of the world developed and how do we sort good and bad explanations? Is there a limit to our knowledge of the world? On this program, Prof. David Deutsch discussed the beginning of infinity.

episodes.title: Absolutely Small -- Groks Science Show 2011-08-31
episodes.description: Quantum mechanics may seem to be an intimidating topic, yet it is fundamental to understanding the everyday world. On this program, Prof. Michael Fayer discussed how quantum theory explains our everyday world.

episodes.title: Apollo 15 -- Groks Science Show 2011-08-24
episodes.description: The Apollo program is a landmark in the history of space exploration and perhaps the most successful mission of the series was Apollo 15.  On this program, Ret. Col. Al Worden discussed the space program and Apollo 15.

episodes.title: Anosmia -- Groks Science Show 2011-08-17
episodes.description: The sense of smell may often seem to be expendable, yet it has a pivotal role in both our survival and hedonic enjoyment of food. On this program, Molly Birnbaum discussed the role of smell in our daily lives.

episodes.title: Memes -- Groks Science Show 2011-08-10
episodes.description: Why do some ideas thrive, while others rarely see the light of day? Is there a competition for ideas and are they selected in much the same way that evolution selects for succesful genes? On this program, Jonnie Hughes discusses memes and the Origin of Tepees.

episodes.title: Internet Scams -- Groks Science Show 2011-08-03
episodes.description: The advent of new technologies has opened up a new avenue for scam artists. How do we protect ourselves against scams online and in daily life? On this program, Fred Claridge discussed tips for avoiding internet scam artists.

episodes.title: Wonderous Universe -- Groks Science Show 2011-07-27
episodes.description: The universe is a large and mysterious place. How did it begin? How will it end? And, what are the steps along the way? On this program, Prof. Brian Cox discussed the wonders of the universe.

episodes.title: Food Addiction -- Groks Science Show 2011-07-20
episodes.description: Food addiction may be a major cause of obesity. What are the causes of food addiction and how can they be overcome? On this program, Hedley Turk discussed why intelligent people are overweight.

episodes.title: Character Flux -- Groks Science Show 2011-07-06
episodes.description: Although we often view our moral character as being immutable, behavioral research has begun to demonstrate the intense flexibility of our moral character. On this program, David DeSteno discussed the biology of character.

episodes.title: Medical Caveats -- Groks Science Show 2011-06-29

episodes.title: Geek Dad -- Groks Science Show 2011-04-27

episodes.title: Environmental Biodiversity -- Groks Science Show 2011-04-20

episodes.title: Polar Bears -- Groks Science Show 2011-03-23

episodes.title: New Cool -- Groks Science Show 2011-03-16

episodes.title: Belief Instinct -- Groks Science Show 2011-03-09

episodes.title: Forensic Beginnings -- Groks Science Show 2011-03-02
episodes.description: Forensic science has developed many advanced methods to aid crimanologists. On this program, Douglas Starr discussed the origins of forensic science.

episodes.description: Space may be the final frontier, but exploring it will require plenty of ingenuity. What is in store for space exploration in 2011? On this program, Tariq Malik discussed the upcoming year in space exploration.

episodes.title: Pebble Planet -- Groks Science Show 2011-01-12

episodes.description: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) is a commonly diagnosed in young children. However, alternatives exist to the common treatments. On this program, Nancy ODell and Patricia Cook discussed stopping ADHD.

However, recent advances are now sparking renewed promise and focus. On this program, Dr. Michael McKubre and Dr. Irving Dardik discussed the advances in cold fusion research.

episodes.title: Flotsametrics -- Groks Science Show 2009-04-29
episodes.description: Ocean currents are essential for the proper functioning of the global environment. Surprisingly, these currents may be studied by simply observing the items that float on it. On this program, Dr. Curt Ebbesmeyer discussed flotsametrics.

episodes.title: Accelerating Evolution -- Groks Science Show 2009-04-22
episodes.description: The effects of evolutionary pressures on recent human development have often been overlooked. Yet, within the past ten thousand years, modern humans may have been evolving under enormous selective pressures. On this program, Prof. Gregory Cochran discussed how civilization accelerated human evolution.

episodes.title: Supersense -- Groks Science Show 2009-04-15
episodes.description: Everybody forms a model of the natural world based on their experience with it. However, sometimes these models are flawed and lead to superstitious beliefs. On this program, Dr. Bruce Hood discussed the origins of superstitious beliefs and why we believe in the unbelievable.

episodes.title: Overdosed America -- Groks Science Show 2009-04-08
episodes.description: The pharmaceutical industry has produced numerous medications for a wide range of ailments. However, not all of these medications may be the safest, cheapest, or most efficacious form of treatment. On this program, Dr. John Abramson discussed Overdosed America.

episodes.title: Robotic Warfare -- Groks Science Show 2009-04-01
episodes.description: Modern warfare increasingly utilizes robotic weaponry. Yet, the rules of robotic engagement have not been developed as completely as the technology. On this program, Dr. P.W. Singer discussed the challenges of robotic warfare.

episodes.title: Vaccine Safety -- Groks Science Show 2009-03-25
episodes.description: Modern vaccines have contained many diseases in the world. Yet, despite their success, or perhaps because of it, dubious concerns have been raised regarding their safety and necessity. On this program, Dr. Martin Myers discussed the safety of modern vaccines.

episodes.title: Ethanol Production -- Groks Science Show 2009-03-18
episodes.description: The search for alternative fuel sources is a major concern, and ethanol is a factor in this new energy market. New technologies for converting cellulose to ethanol may help supply much of the demand. On this program, Arnold Klann discussed bluefire ethanol.

episodes.title: Longevity Factor -- Groks Science Show 2009-03-11
episodes.description: Living a long and healthy life is possible with the right combination of food and exercise. And, new research is demonstrating the importance of polyphenols, such as resveratrol. On this program, Dr. Joseph Maroon discussed the longevity factor.

episodes.title: Smithsonian Ocean -- Groks Science Show 2009-03-04
episodes.description: The oceans are essential for human survival. The Sant Ocean Hall at the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History seeks to educate the public about the importance of the oceans. On this program, Deborah Cramer discussed Smithsonian Ocean, Our Water, Our World.

episodes.title: DSM Dilemma -- Groks Science Show 2009-02-25
episodes.description: The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders is considered the bible of modern psychiatry. However, many of the listed disorders are not without controversy. On this program, Prof. Christopher Lane discussed the issues surrounding the DSM IV.

episodes.title: Numbers Game -- Groks Science Show 2009-02-18
episodes.description: Large numbers and statistics constantly bombard us in the news, but putting those numbers into context is essential for understanding their real meaning. On this program, Andrew Dilnot from Oxford University discussed the numbers game.

episodes.title: Evolutionary Truth -- Groks Science Show 2009-02-11
episodes.description: Darwin Day, celebrated on Feb. 12, marks the 200th birthday anniversary of Charles Darwin and the 150th anniversary of his famed publication, On the Origin of Species. Yet, despite the overwhelming evidence supporting the modern evolutionary theory, controversy still abounds. On this program, Prof. Jerry Coyne from the University of Chicago discussed why evolution is true.

episodes.title: Game Theory -- Groks Science Show 2009-02-04
episodes.description: Game theory is the field of study popularized by the depiction of John Nash in a Beautiful Mind. But, few may realize the relevance of game theory in everyday life. On this program, Dr. Len Fisher discussed the application of game theory to everyday situations.

episodes.title: Mars Exploration -- Groks Science Show 2009-01-28
episodes.description: Mars has garnered attention for generations, but the possible colonization of Mars especially tantalizes the imagination. On this program, Dr. Robert Zubrin discussed the possibilities for colonizing Mars.

episodes.title: Fermilab Higgs -- Groks Science Show 2009-01-21
episodes.description: Fermi National Accelerator Lab, better known as Fermilab, has been actively searching for the elusive Higgs Boson. However, the clock is ticking and their time may soon be up. On this program, Clayton Brown discussed the Atom Smashers.

episodes.title: Airplanes -- Groks Science Show 2009-01-14
episodes.description: Airplanes are modern marvels whose ingenious development is the result of decades of innovation from numerous pioneers, thinkers, and tinkerers. On this program, Mr. Jay Spenser discussed the history of the airplane.

episodes.title: Adult ADD -- Groks Science Show 2009-01-07
episodes.description: Attention Deficit Disorder is a condition that is thought to mainly affect children. However, more adults are being diagnosed with the condition. On this program, Dr. Lara Honos-Webb discussed the gift of adult ADD.

episodes.title: Biosolar -- Groks Science Show 2008-12-31
episodes.description: Current energy challenges will require advances in alternative energy technology. One of the most promising is solar power. On this program, Dr. David Lee discussed advances in biosolar materials.

episodes.title: Body Mechanics -- Groks Science Show 2008-12-24
episodes.description: The remarkable construction of the human body often provokes many questions, especially among children, but providing the answers may stump most adults. On this program, Dr. Beth Ann Ditkoff discussed how the body works. In addition, Prof. Mason Porter discussed Oxford mathematics.

episodes.title: Everyday Survival -- Groks Science Show 2008-12-17
episodes.description: The ability to rapidly adapt to the environment is a hallmark of most higher organisms. However, humans have created special challenges to surviving in the modern landscape. On this program, Laurence Gonzales discussed everyday survival.

episodes.title: Cartesian Philosophy -- Groks Science Show 2008-12-10
episodes.description: Cogito Ergo Sum. I think therefore I am. The philosophy of Rene Descartes has impacted modern society in many arenas from the sciences to the foundations of democratic governments. On this program, Russell Shorto discussed the history of Cartesian philosophy. This episode is dedicated to the memory of Prof. Jeffery A. Winer, friend and mentor.

episodes.title: Digital Natives -- Groks Science Show 2008-12-03
episodes.description: Digital technology has radically changed the landscape of modern life, but what does this mean for those born into this digital era? On this program, Prof. John Palfrey discussed the digital natives.

episodes.title: Food Supply -- Groks Science Show 2008-11-26
episodes.description: Although food production in the world has seen tremendous advances, recent challenges may threaten the supply of food. On this program, Paul Roberts discussed these challenges and the end of food.

episodes.title: Happiness -- Groks Science Show 2008-11-19
episodes.description: Happiness is a state that most people try to achieve, but which often seems elusive. How can science inform our understanding of the pursuit of happiness? On this program, Prof. Ed Diener discussed the science of happiness.

episodes.title: Information Bridge -- Groks Science Show 2008-11-12
episodes.description: Although information technology has revolutionized modern life, many parts of the world still require considerable development. On this program, Manolo Figallo discussed bridging the information gap in developing parts of the world.

episodes.title: Dominant Animal -- Groks Science Show 2008-11-05
episodes.description: Humans have evolved to become the dominant life form on the planet, but in the process have extracted a heavy toll on the environment. On this program, Prof. Paul Ehrlich discussed human population biology and its relation to the environment.

episodes.title: Therapy Clouds -- Groks Science Show 2008-10-29
episodes.description: Wireless technology is providing a novel approach to physical therapy that may vastly improve recovery efforts. On this program, Robert Prunetti discussed wireless therapy. In addition, cloud computing networks may be the next step for mobile computing and data storage. Joining us was Daryl Adams, who discussed the advantages of cloud computing.

episodes.title: Software Security -- Groks Science Show 2008-10-22
episodes.description: Although computer software is a ubiquitous facet of daily life, the security of most applications leaves much to be desired. On this program, David Rice discussed the real cost of insecure software.

episodes.title: Human Cognition -- Groks Science Show 2008-10-15
episodes.description: Although evolution has only recently led to the emergence of the human species, the capacities of the human brain may be unique in the animal kingdom. On this program, Prof. Michael Gazzaniga discussed the cognitive neuroscience of the human brain.

episodes.title: Drugs -- Groks Science Show 2008-10-08
episodes.description: Drugs are a ubiquitous part of modern life. However, separating the facts from the myths about drug use can often be a challenge. On this program, Prof. Cynthia Kuhn discussed the science of drugs.

episodes.title: Shift Age -- Groks Science Show 2008-10-01
episodes.description: The rapid pace of technological change is daunting for those attempting to predict the outcome of these many innovations. On this program, David Houle discussed living in the Shift Age and its implications for the future.

episodes.title: Science Diplomacy -- Groks Science Show 2008-09-24
episodes.description: Science is often construed as being divorced from diplomatic considerations. Yet, scientists, due to their shared concerns, are uniquely poised to break political and national barriers. On this program, Cathy Campbell discussed the importance of science diplomacy.

episodes.title: Sex Evolution -- Groks Science Show 2008-09-17
episodes.description: Although love is said to make the world go round, most might concede that sex is the real prime mover. On this program, Faye Flam discussed how the quest for sex has shaped the modern man.

episodes.title: Edge of Science -- Groks Science Show 2008-09-10
